key_facts: Gemini now supports multi-step automation on Android â€” e.g., ordering food (DoorDash), hailing rides (Uber), grocery delivery, and scam detection
Launched at Samsung Unpacked; initially available on Samsung Galaxy S26 and Google Pixel 10/10 Pro
Includes enhanced Circle to Search and deeper OS-level integration beyond Siriâ€™s current capabilities
Represents Googleâ€™s first major consumer-facing rollout of agent-like automation on mobile
analyst_angle: This marks a pivotal shift from reactive AI assistants to proactive, cross-app task agents â€” signaling the start of the 'AI agent OS' era and intensifying platform-level competition with Apple's delayed Siri+Intelligence rollout.

title: ğŸš€ Google DeepMind & Databricks Launch Genie Research Agent

sources.author: databricks
sources.text:
What if you could surface new insights from your enterprise data by just asking questions?

Genie Research Agent is built for forward-looking questions. Hereâ€™s how it works:
- Ask a question like â€œHow

key_facts: Genie Research Agent is a new AI system that transforms natural language questions into autonomous, iterative research workflows
It builds hypotheses, tests them against enterprise data, refines iteratively, and delivers results in natural language, tables, visuals, and exportable PDF
Jointly developed by Google DeepMind (world models / agent foundations) and Databricks (enterprise data + AI infrastructure)
analyst_angle: This signals a major shift from static LLM querying to autonomous, goal-directed AI agents operating over real enterprise data â€” bridging world modeling theory with production-grade analytics.

key_facts: Codex 5.3 achieves 5.3 TOPS and surpasses Claude Opus 4.6 on agentic coding benchmarks
It delivers significantly faster inference but lags Opus 4.6 in overall global average score
A new 155K-trajectory coding agent dataset is released, boosting SWE-bench Verified from 23% to 59.4% via SFT
analyst_angle: While Codex 5.3 claims leadership in agentic coding speed and task-specific performance, its weaker general capability highlights the growing tension between specialized 'agentic' benchmarks and holistic model evaluation â€” and underscores how high-quality datasets (like the new 155K trajectories) are becoming critical leverage points for rapid capability gains.

analyst_angle: This isnâ€™t just strong earnings â€” itâ€™s evidence of NVIDIA executing a structural moat via vertical supply control, accelerating the AI infrastructure supercycle while sidelining competitors unable to secure capacity.

title: ğŸ’¡ Viral AI Dystopian Post Triggers Hedge Fund Short-Squeeze Panic

sources.author: firstadopter
sources.text: February 2026 month-end hedge fund letter: "We underperformed in February because we degrossed after an former paramedic dropout wrote a hypothetical AI dystopian scenario in a viral post that had no

key_facts: A viral, speculative AI dystopian social media postâ€”lacking factual evidence or logical coherenceâ€”triggered unwarranted short-selling pressure among hedge funds
Multiple hedge funds reportedly degrossed positions in response, leading to underperformance and potential short squeezes
Mainstream financial media expressed skepticism about the postâ€™s credibility, yet some funds reacted disproportionately
analyst_angle: Highlights growing market fragility when unverified AI narrativesâ€”amplified by social media and media echo chambersâ€”override fundamental risk discipline, exposing systemic vulnerability to 'narrative-driven volatility' in quant and macro strategies.

sources.author: TechCrunch
sources.text: OpenClaw creatorâ€™s advice to AI builders is to be more playful and allow yourself time to improve. Peter Steinberger talks about the creation of his viral AI agent OpenClaw and how being more "playful

key_facts: OpenClaw is a viral, open-ended AI agent framework built by Peter Steinberger (referenced via @bindureddy and TechCrunch);

The core thesis â€” promoted by both Steinberger and Omar Sarwar (@omarsar0) â€” is that 'agentic engineering' enables developers to rapidly build custom, production-grade AI orchestrators and agents without waiting for commercial IDEs/TUIs/SDKs;

Steinberger built OpenClaw in ~10 days; Sarwar reports building a full-featured, self-evolving orchestrator (including WhatsApp-integrated enterprise workflows via 'Open Claw ğŸ¦') and reproducing novel agent features in hours.
analyst_angle: This reflects a quiet but accelerating shift from consumption-first AI tooling to creation-first agentic infrastructure â€” where open, composable, and developer-owned orchestrators erode the moat of centralized agent platforms.

title: ğŸš€ Cursor AI Agent Achieves Autonomous One-Shot Website Reconstruction from Video

sources.author: swyx
sources.text:
thanks to @edwinarbus kindly giving me access I was able to try this out:

literally just dropped the below tweet into @cursor_ai cloud, expecting this to not work because its a pretty hard task. 

CU

sources.author: swyx
sources.text:
ok i felt bad because this attempt does such injustice to @racheljychen. here's the followup prompt:

"good start but lots of differences including alignment of the header to the body, and missing lot

key_facts: Cursor AI's cloud-based agent autonomously reconstructed Rachel Chen's website (racheljychen.com) in 43 minutes solely from a Twitter video â€” no code, no instructions beyond the video link.

A second, refined prompt triggered a follow-up 43-minute autonomous session that performed deep inspection (network snooping, headless crawling, asset recovery, sitemap generation) and parallel subagent orchestration to achieve high-fidelity visual/functional cloning.
The demonstration showcases end-to-end autonomous web reconstruction â€” including dynamic elements like the 'RachelLLM' sidebar â€” without human intervention during execution.
analyst_angle: This signals a major leap in agentic AI capabilities: moving from task-specific copilots to self-directed, multi-step, tool-using autonomous agents that can reverse-engineer and rebuild complex frontend systems â€” potentially disrupting web development, QA, legacy migration, and rapid prototyping workflows.

analyst_angle: This reveals a hardening inflection point: AI scaling is no longer just about algorithms or dataâ€”itâ€™s now a capital-, power-, and semiconductor-constrained race where strategic partnerships and financial viability dictate technological ambition.

title: ğŸš€ Hermes: Persistent, Self-Improving AI Agent That Builds Reusable Skills Across Sessions

sources.author: LiorOnAI
sources.text:
Most AI agents are amnesiacs. They solve a problem brilliantly, then forget everything the moment you close the terminal. 

Hermes flips this: it's an agent that writes down what it learns and gets be

sources.author: MLStreetTalk
sources.text: By "agentic applications" I don't mean like on Gmail where you have an agent that can do a few superficial things like searching for email. I mean "agentic-native". Where nearly every single low-level

key_facts: Hermes is a locally hosted AI agent that maintains persistent state across sessions â€” unlike stateless cloud assistants.
It automatically documents successful problem-solving approaches as searchable, reusable procedural skills.
Runs on user's dedicated machine (not sandboxed cloud), enabling filesystem access, unattended scheduling, isolated subagents, and deep integration with the user's environment.
Introduces 'procedural memory' â€” remembering *how* to do things, not just facts â€” enabling compounding intelligence over time.
analyst_angle: Hermes signals a paradigm shift from disposable, session-bound AI assistants to persistent, agentic-native software â€” potentially redefining enterprise automation, developer tooling, and personal AI infrastructure.

title: ğŸš€ Profound Launches AI Agent Platform for Brand Discovery & Autonomous Transactions

sources.author: lightspeedvp
sources.text:
â€œEvery marketer on the planet is going to care about how AI talks about their brand.â€

Discovery, as we know it, is beginning to shift.

This week on The Investment Memo, @tryprofound Co-Founder & CEO

sources.author: lightspeedvp
sources.text:
Profound CEO James Cadwalader on why AI changes everything about how we discover products online:

"If I ask ChatGPT for an insurance quote, the next obvious step is: cool, can you go and buy the insu

key_facts: Profound, co-founded by James Cadwallader and Dylan Babbs, has launched a platform enabling AI agents to discover, evaluate, and transact on behalf of users â€” shifting brand visibility from passive search to active agent-driven commerce

The company positions itself as building the 'analytics wedge' for Fortune 500 brands to adapt to AI-native discovery, where LLMs (e.g., ChatGPT) evolve from answer engines into autonomous purchasing agents

Core thesis: AI agents will soon perform end-to-end workflows â€” e.g., requesting an insurance quote *and then buying the policy* â€” making brand interoperability with agent protocols (not just SEO) mission-critical
analyst_angle: This signals the inflection point where marketing shifts from optimizing for human attention or keyword ranking to designing for AI agent intent, API readiness, and transactional trust â€” effectively redefining digital shelf presence for the agentic era.

title: ğŸ“œ White House & Trump Admin Push AI Firms to Cover Electricity Rate Hikes

sources.author: TechCrunch

sources.author: TechCrunch
sources.text: The White House wants AI companies to cover rate hikes. Most have already said they would.. Many hyperscalers have already made public commitments to cover electricity cost increases.

sources.author: The Verge
sources.text: Trump claims tech companies will sign deals next week to pay for their own power supply. President Donald Trump tried to quell Americans' concerns about rising electricity costs during his State of th

key_facts: The White House (and separately, former President Trump) is urging major AI companies and hyperscalers to publicly commit to absorbing electricity cost increases tied to AI data center expansion
Multiple hyperscalersâ€”including Microsoft, Google, and Amazonâ€”have already made public commitments to cover utility rate hikes for their facilities
Trump claimed a 'rate payer protection pledge' with tech firms would be finalized next week, framing it as consumer protection amid surging grid demand from AI infrastructure
analyst_angle: This marks the first major U.S. policy intervention directly linking AI infrastructure growth to energy cost accountabilityâ€”setting a precedent for regulatory expectations around externalities of compute scaling.
